author: jon
text: 'Good spot to get an egg and cheese with a hashbrown. Decent breakfast sandwiches wouldn‚Äôt get more then that. Unfortunately does not look very clean. Wish they would just clean the place up a bit and use gloves lol'

author: Emily Ng
text: 'good sandwich with fresh mozzarella
column5: tomato
column7: and peppers. wish the bread had more texture or flavor

author: Kristy George
text: 'Tons of options
column5: somewhat overwhelming looking at the paper menu and menu boards displayed inside. The quality and quantity justifies visits to this true Italian gem. Worth every cent. Friendly staff. Sometimes a line but worth the wait!'

author: Robert Stewart
text: 'Excellent meal. Fast friendly service!'

author: Alexandra Auth
text: "Sad pregnant lady here! I usually order platters from Lisa's when I have family and friends in town and today I stopped in 8.5 months pregnant to pick up lunch for my husband and I. I ordered the mufuletta sandwich and got home
column5: they didn't include olives or peppers
column6: just meat sliced way too thick and provolone. So sad

author: Elizabeth Wasserman
text: 'This place is pretty good. I think they have great sandwiches and I like the macaroni salad. I got wings here once and thought it was a mistake
column5: stick to sandwiches. The chicken cutlet is great.'

author: jordan metz
text: 'Great people but they don‚Äôt make their own mozz anymore and they use an inferior prosciutto de Parma. I hadn‚Äôt been there in a couple years and could tell at first bite that everything was different. Bread was kinda stale too.'

author: B Mason
text: 'Did you guys just deliver me a delicious sandwich to my door TWELVE minutes after I clicked ‚Äòorder‚Äô on seamless ?!?!  Oh my good lord wow!! Thats a hoboken record!!!!'

author: Andrew Freeman
text: 'This is a great deli! They have a ton of fun specialty sandwiches/subs that we love going through. Great menu
column5: definitely recommend.'

author: Robert Gemmell
text: "If you are ever in Hoboken you must try Lisa's.  The sopressata along with all their meat is fresh and sandwiches are to die for."

author: Ron George
text: 'Staff was very friendly'

author: Grant Williams
text: 'Real good bread'

author: Justin
text: 'Hours say open until 7
column5: but kitchen isn‚Äôt actually open.'

author: Olafia ‚ÄúRain‚Äù Lesko
text: 'So I ordered a bunch of a  different sandwiches while we were moving out of the apartment for everybody that was helping us . The order included turkey and chicken salad ham and then I saw this delicious looking salami mozzarella sandwich so I got two of those but instead  of receiving these mozzarella. Salami sandwiches I got 2 additional turkey. I wish we could have gotten 2 DIFFERENT additional  sandwiches. Ideally they would have called and asked what we wanted instead . Maybe they were missing some ingredients which is fine. Totally understand. but from experience in the service industry I‚Äôm assuming they were just lazy or wanted to save a buck. I don‚Äôt know the answer because they didn‚Äôt call'

author: BK Love
text: 'This place is as legit as it gets. Italian imports
column5: in house made fresh mozzarella. Look if you‚Äôre scrolling around google maps looking for a deli you found it look no farther. You just struck gold.'

author: Robert37
text: 'Great food. Great people. Long history. since the 1940s a must-try when in Hoboken'

author: Nate Ortega
text: 'Just eat a sandwich and you will know'

author: D ANDREWS
text: "Spent the day in Brooklyn and needed to feed the family. Read the reviews online for Lisa's
column5: but that didn't tell the story of how fantastic the sandwiches tasted. In short...phenomenal and definitely a highlight if my first trip to New Jersey. Be warned...they have a sandwich for every appetite and desire. Fresh meats and cheeses
column6: plus fresh bread equal a fantastic sandwich. Bonus for me...I got to show my boys the type of Italian deli I frequented in my youth. They also carry a large number of foods from prosciutto to salami to fresh cheeses to massive cans of tomatoes. Parking is a bit tricky but it's definitely worth the effort. Will absolutely visit again!"

author: Laura Olivieri
text: "I grew up living on the delicious varieties and the best deli meats and sandwiches! Thank you Lisa's
column5: you're a big part of my childhood!"

author: Steven Hic
text: 'Amazing hero‚Äôs and mozzarella!'

author: Kathleen Heaney
text: "We order dinner from here a least 1 night a week
column5: often times more. They have the best chicken parm sandwich in town and their selection of paninis is superb! Try the Turkey Marco Polo Panini

author: Betsy Freeman
text: "Wow
column5: just moved to Hoboken and found Lisa's. Great find! Unbelievable fresh mozzarella

text: 'This place is terrible.  When I ordered my sandwich of ham and mozzarella
column5: I got  lettuce on it. The other day I went to M&P‚Äôs and  it was the bomb. I was going to this place to get some sandwiches and it is garbage. I hate this place üí©üí©üí©üí©üí©üí©üí©üëéüèø'

author: Jesse Holliday
text: 'For Mutz
column5: this is as good as it gets. I‚Äôve had it all over Hoboken and Lisa‚Äôs takes the cake. The owners are awesome. Sandwiches are really good too but sometimes take a while to make. They also have bread from various bakeries around town.'

author: Mary Ann Farley
text: "Sorry
column5: but sandwich is a total fail
column6: mainly because of the price. $10 for a basic sub? Seriously? I asked the guy for added sweet peppers
column8: as Subway has gotten me used to toppings
column9: and he forgot to put them on! I called the place
column10: thinking the price meant he had left them out
column11: but nope..that's the price of a basic sub! Had he added my toppings
column12: the sandwich would have been $12!  Recently I went to Kings and got the same sandwich
column13: with all the toppings I wanted
column14: and it was $7.99. And that was with the best cold cuts and amazing provolone. Sorry Lisa... this is price gauging. Will NEVER go there again. UPDATE: Just ate some of this thing. Meh. They're even stingy with what they DO give you. And thick sliced meat? What?"

author: nema
text: 'Awesome'

author: David Horowitz
text: 'Amazing deli. I get a sandwhich here like once a week and its always amazing. They have great mutz and sopressata.'

author: Kyria Johnson
text: "I've been coming here for years.  It's my 2nd favorite fresh mozzarella in Hoboken.  The pricing here for cold cuts beats a lot of the other delis plus the employees are pretty quick with their service. Sometimes the freshness of the food is hit or miss depending on when you go but generally it's pretty solid.  A safe go to is always the italian hero boy.  Sandwiches are pretty big and they are cool with people asking them to be even bigger lol."

text: 'Terrific'

text: "Fat Buffalo!\nForget everything else
column5: just get the fat buffalo with ranch! Best Lisa's Italian Deli & Caterer you'll ever eat! I have dreams about this Lisa's Italian Deli & Caterer\nI sure wish these guys would open a spot down in OC. I'd eat there every single week but it's a far drive for me."

text: 'I used to order from here all the time. However one day I placed an order on the phone they said it would be ready in 20 minutes. I went to the deli after 20 minutes and waited inside the place for 15 minutes and it still wasn‚Äôt ready.'

text: 'Food is tastes just as good as when I used to eat lunch here back in 1986-1987 when I was in HS . FRESH mozzarella with prosciutto is to die for!'

author: Andres Diaz
text: 'Lisas has been getting worse as the years go by the prices go up and the sandwhiches get smaller. $10 for a sandwhich that had a tiny peice of mottz and 2 slices of pepperoni and the rest was lettuce and tomatos smh! last time i ever buy lunch here'

text: 'We stopped here on a tour of Hoboken and it was awesome. Tony
column5: the owner

text: 'Without a doubt THE best place for fresh mozzarella...the BEST...literally melts in your mouth!'

text: 'Order was delayed by almost a half hour.. called and was assured it would be there in the next 10 minutes. The place closed and food never showed up.'

text: 'I have been coming here for over ten years and over the last few months it has gone down hill

text: 'They take way too long to make the order

author: Brittany R
text: 'Wish I can give this place 0 stars. I placed an order for 2 sandwiches at 1:45. It is 3:40 and still nothing. I have called numerous times and no one is even picking up the phone. Worst customer service. EVER.'

text: 'Recommend their panini here

text: 'A real find! Endless menu

text: 'Amazing mozzarella!'

text: 'The biggest menu you have ever seen and all of it is outstanding. One of the better delis in Hoboken in my opinion. The only thing keeping it from a 5 is that can be painfully slow sometimes.'

author: Captain Nimo
text: 'I do not give 10 Stars because it is not an option. Holy sht. Excuse my French. They make awesome sandwiches. Employees are super cool and polite. I can go to 100 places between my home and this location. I choose them. Sandwich was so good
column5: I didnt make it to my car. Ate it on my hood. I drive an Audi. A nice one. That is how serious the sandwiches and paninis are.'

text: 'Great food'

text: "I had a craving for a meatball parm. There was an appropriate amount of sauce so the roll didn't get soggy. Great value."

text: 'Great food!!'

text: 'The mozzarella is amazing as well as the cold cuts'

author: Lana Farina
text: "Horrible experience. Waited in line 20 minutes while watching FOUR guys take 1 order at a time and fulfill it before taking the next. Many have commented on their slowless. It's no joke. I thought at least I would get a really good sandwich. Not! Go to Vitos."

author: Dustin Glass
text: 'Sandwiches and pastas are top quality
column5: as is the fresh mozzarella.  The menu is never-ending so they will basically make you any sandwich you want.'

author: john disomma
text: "Had a chicken parm from Lisa's it was the worst dry and burnt ive had better at crappy pizzarias for a deli thats been here so long you would think at least there parm sandwhiches would be good I'll be ordering from Tornas from now on!"

author: David Jaslow
text: 'Great Italian deli!'

author: Emily Abramson
text: 'Tiny shop with AMAZING italian sandwiches.'

author: Roberto Feliciano
text: "One of the best Italian deli's in NJ.\nGREAT EATS!!"

author: Tim Goodvin
text: 'Great fresh Mozzarella. Better than some places in Italy.\nA really good selection of fresh loaves.\nVery good Italian sandwiches made to order. It is absolutely one of my favorite guilty pleasures.'

author: Nathan James
text: 'Disaster. If they moved any slower
column5: they would be going backwards. I also witnessed one of the cooks joking around throwing deli slices at another one of the cooks while making sandwiches. Not the most hygienic practice... Too many delis in northern NJ to waste my time and money here.'

author: Ricardo Takatu
text: 'Tip: fresh mozzarella.'

author: Glenn Howard
text: 'Best fresh mozzarella‚Ä¶ Anywhere!!!'

author: ◊§◊ú◊ï◊†◊ô ◊ê◊ú ◊û◊ï◊†◊ô
text: 'Great
column5: but very expensive'

author: Justin Levine
text: "Went here the other day to grab food for lunch and the train ride home.  Got two sandwiches
column5: one hot with roast beef
column8: and sauteed onions; the other with hot soppresata
column12: and roasted red peppers.  Had a little problem communicating with the counter staff
column13: but they were friendly enough and let me get a sample of the bresaola and mozzarella.  The mozzarella here didn't impress me that much
column14: pretty good but far from the best.  Their bread on the other hand was perfect
column15: not too dense not too light.  The roast beef sandwich was bursting with beefy flavor
column16: and was incredible.  The soppresata was great too
column17: although the soppresata itself could've had more flavor
column18: but the roasted red peppers were excellent and the balsamic gave it a nice kick.  They put chunks of provolone on the sandwich instead of slices
column19: but I just took a couple chunks off and the sandwich was fine."

author: Paul Lichstein
text: "This place is the little Italian neighborhood deli perfected.   If that is not what you are looking for superficial friendliness and fast service you should go to Chipotle.    Sharp provolone is aged in the basement.  Mutz is excellent.   Prosciutto is perfection.   Choice of breads from the local bakers is large though I am partial to Dom's.   Cleanliness is not obsessively sought so by the end of the day the place can look a little rough.   Same guys have been behind the counter for 20 years.   If you are doing delivery or ordering on line you are missing the charm of making small talk with the guys behind the counter and hanging with your neighbors while your stuff is being made."

author: Dinesh Narwani
text: 'Worst customer service
column5: rude employee at the front counter. Person like her should not be upfront helping customer otherwise you will continue to lose customers. Never coming back again.'

author: Katie Desmond
text: 'Great chicken and meatball parm sandwiches.'

author: Brad Schwarz
text: 'My wife and I ordered from Lisa\'s tonight. First of all
column5: there is a $2.00 delivery fee
column6: even though nothing is stated on the web site
column8: or over the phone when you ask for delivery. The food was OK
column10: we were missing a side of fries. No big deal - we called and "Lisa" said she would send it out. Ten minutes later
column11: "Lisa" called back and asked if we had found our fries in the bag. I told her no. She said that she would send a delivery guy out. After 30 minutes
column12: I called to see where our fries were
column13: and was told that the delivery guy was out delivering the food right now. Another thirty minutes later (now almost two hours after the original order)
column14: I called and got the "cleaning crew" who said that they do not work there. When I asked why they answered the phone
column15: I was yelled at and the person said "Lisa\'s is closed - we just answer the phone to see if its the boss". Too bad ... you just lost a customer for good.'
